page.title: 10INDUSTRY IN STOURBRIDGE
page.content: Due to the prescence of{minerals}, Stourbridge became an industrial centre.There was a clothing trade until the last century.Coal was mined, e.g. in the Dingle,Pedmore.Main industries used to be nail making,chains,anvils,spades,shovels and scythes.Near Lye,immigrant Hungarians made glass on Hungary Hill in 1556.The River Stour,the canal and the railway encouraged industrial {development}.These original industries have declined.Some metal based industries remained in the Stour Valley but there is also a new trading estate adjacent to the Stourbridge ring road,sited on the canal wharves. Its industries include stock holders, sportswear and removal firms.Other industries in the area include upholstery,glove and frozen food {manufacturers}.
